Speaker: story by
Dialogue: Byron Howard, Rich Moore, Jared Bush, Jim Reardon, Josie Trinidad, Phil Johnston and Jennifer Lee

Speaker: young judy
Dialogue: Blood, blood, blood!

Speaker: astronaut sheep
Dialogue: Yeah, I don't have to cower in a herd anymore.

Speaker: actuary jaguar
Dialogue: I don't have to be a lonely hunter any more.

Speaker: actuary
Dialogue: Today I can hunt for tax exemptions. I'm gonna be an actuary!

Speaker: young judy
Dialogue: And I can make the world a better place! I am going to be...

Speaker: gideon grey
Dialogue: Bunny cop. That is the most stupidest thing I ever heard.

Speaker: young judy
Dialogue: It may seem impossible to small minds--  I'm looking at you Gideon Grey.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Judy, you ever wonder how your mom and me got to be so darn happy?

Speaker: young judy
Dialogue: Nope.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Well, we gave up on our dreams and we settled, right Bon?

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: Oh yes, that's right, Stu. We settled hard.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: See, that's the beauty of complacency, Jude. If you don't try anything new, you'll never fail.

Speaker: young judy
Dialogue: I like trying, actually.

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: What your father means, hon, is it's gonna be difficult-- impossible even-- for you to become a police officer.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Right. There's never been a bunny cop.

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Bunnies don't do that.

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: Never.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Never.

Speaker: young judy
Dialogue: Oh. Then I guess I'll have to be the first one. Because I am gonna make the world...  A better place!

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: OR... um, heck, you wanna talk about making the world a better place--

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: Yes! Your dad, me, your 275 brothers and sisters-- we're changing the world.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Yep.

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: One carrot at a time...

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Amen to that. Carrot farming is a noble profession.

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: You get it. I mean, it's great to have dreams.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Yeah, just as long as you don't believe in em too much.  Where in the heck'd she go?

Speaker: gideon grey
Dialogue: Gimme your tickets right now, or I'm gonna kick your meek little sheep butt.

Speaker: sharla
Dialogue: Ow! Cut it out, Gideon!

Speaker: gideon grey
Dialogue: Baa-baa. What're ya gonna do, cry?

Speaker: gideon grey
Dialogue: Nice costume, loser. What crazy world are you living in where you think a bunny could be a cop?

Speaker: young judy
Dialogue: Kindly return my friends' tickets.

Speaker: gideon grey
Dialogue: Come and get `em.... But watch out, `cause I'm a fox-- and like you said in your dumb little stage play, us predators used to eat prey. And that killer instinct's still in our Dunnahh.

Speaker: gideon grey
Dialogue: Don't tell me what I know, Travis.

Speaker: young judy
Dialogue: You don't scare me, Gideon.

Speaker: gideon grey
Dialogue: You scared now?

Speaker: gideon grey
Dialogue: Cry little baby bunny. Cry, cry --

Speaker: sharla
Dialogue: Are you okay, Judy?

Speaker: young judy
Dialogue: Yeah... Yeah, I'm okay.

Speaker: sharla
Dialogue: Wow! You got our tickets!

Speaker: sharla
Dialogue: Yeah! That Gideon Grey doesn't know what he's talkin' `bout.

Speaker: young judy
Dialogue: Well, he was right about one thing...

Speaker: major friedkin
Dialogue: Listen up Cadets! Zootopia has 12 unique ecosystems within its city limits-- Tundra Town, Sahara Square, Rainforest District, to name a few. You're gonna have to master all of them before you hit the streets-- or guess what?  You'll be dead!

Speaker: lionheart
Dialogue: As Mayor of Zootopia, I am proud to announce that my Mammal Inclusion Initiative has produced its first police academy graduate.

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: Oh! Yes right.

Speaker: lionheart
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: Congratulations, Officer Hopps.

Speaker: judy
Dialogue: I won't let you down. This has been my dream since I was a kid.

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: Ya know, it's a... It's a real proud day for us little guys.

Speaker: lionheart
Dialogue: Bellwether, make room will ya? Come on.

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: We're real proud of you, Judy.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Yeah. Scared, too.

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Really, it's kind of a proud-scared combo. I mean, Zootopia. It's so far a away... It's such a big city.

Speaker: judy
Dialogue: Guys-- I've been working for this my whole life.

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: We know. And we're just a little excited for you, but terrified.

Speaker: judy
Dialogue: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: And also bears. We have bears to fear, too. To say nothing of lions, and wolves...

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: Wolves?

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: ...weasels...

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: You play cribbage with a weasel.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: And he cheats like there's no tomorrow. You know what, pretty much all predators-- and Zootopia's full of `em.

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: Oh, Stu.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: And foxes are the worst.

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: Actually, your father does have a point there. It's in their biology. Remember what happened with Gideon Grey.

Speaker: judy
Dialogue: When I was 9. Gideon Grey was a jerk, who happened to be a fox. I know plenty of bunnies who are jerks.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Sure. Yeah, we all do. Absolutely. But just in case, we made you a little care package to take with you.

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: And I put some snacks in there.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: This is fox deterrent.

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: Yeah that's safe to have there.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: This is fox repellent...

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: Okay, the deterrent and the repellent. That's all she needs.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Check this out!

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: Oh for goodness sake. She has no need for a fox taser, Stu.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Oh c'mon. When is there not a need for a fox taser?

Speaker: judy
Dialogue: Okay, look-- I will take this to make you stop talking.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Terrific! Everyone wins!

Speaker: train conductor
Dialogue: Arriving-- Zootopia Express!

Speaker: judy
Dialogue: OK. Gotta go. Bye!

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: Love you, too!

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Oh cripes, here come the waterworks.

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: Oh Stu, pull it together.

Speaker: judy
Dialogue: Bye everybody!

Speaker: cotton
Dialogue: Bye, Judy! I love you!

Speaker: judy
Dialogue: Bye!

Speaker: gazelle
Dialogue: I am Gazelle. Welcome to Zootopia!

Speaker: dharma armadillo
Dialogue: And welcome to the Grand Pangolin Arms. "Luxury Apartments with Charm."

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Thank you!

Speaker: kudu pootosser
Dialogue: Yeah? Well we're loud.

Speaker: oryx pootosser
Dialogue: Don't expect us to apologize for it.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Greasy walls... rickety bed...

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Crazy neighbors...  I love it!

Speaker: leopard
Dialogue: C'mon! He bared his teeth first.

Speaker: clawhauser
Dialogue: O-M goodness! They really did hire a bunny. What?!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Ooo, uh, you probably didn't know, but a bunny can call another bunny "cute," but when other animals do it, it's a little...

Speaker: clawhauser
Dialogue: I am so sorry. Me, Benjamin Clawhauser, the guy everyone thinks is just a flabby, donut-loving cop, stereotyping you...?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: It's okay-- oh, you've actually you've actually got a-- there's a-- in your neck-- the fold-- the-- there's--

Speaker: clawhauser
Dialogue: Oh, there you went, you little dickens!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: I should get to roll call, so... which way do I?

Speaker: clawhauser
Dialogue: Oh! Bullpen's over there to the left.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Great, thank you!

Speaker: clawhauser
Dialogue: Aw... That poor little bunny's gonna get eaten alive.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Hey. Officer Hopps. You ready to make the world a better place?

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: All right, all right. Everybody sit.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Parking duty?  Uh, Chief? Chief Bogo?

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: So.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: So I can handle one. You probably forgot, but I was top of my class at the academy.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Didn't forget. Just don't care.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Sir, I'm not just some "token" bunny.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Well, then writing a hundred tickets a day should be easy.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: 100 tickets...? I'm not gonna write 100 tickets... I'm gonna write 200 tickets!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Boom! 200 tickets before noon.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Where'd he go...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I'm not looking for any trouble either, sir. I simply want to buy a Jumbo Pop for my little boy.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: I'm such a...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Uh, no no, there are. There are. It's just, my boy--  --this goofy little stinker-- he loves all things elephant. Wants to be one when he grows up.

Speaker: elephant
Dialogue: You're holding up the line.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Actually...  I'm an officer. Just had a quick question. Are your customers aware they're getting snot and mucous with their cookies and cream?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Well, I don't wanna cause you any trouble, but I believe scooping ice cream with an un-gloved trunk is a Class 3 Health Code Violation...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: A Jumbo Pop. Please.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: A Jumbo Pop.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Thank you so much.  Thanks, anyway.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Keep the change.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Officer, I can't thank you enough. So kind, really, can I pay you back?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Oh no, my treat-- it just-- y'know, it burns me up to see folks with such backward attitudes toward foxes. I just wanna say, you're a great dad and just a... a real articulate fella.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Ah, well, that is high praise. It's rare that I find someone so non- patronizing... Officer...

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Hopps. Mr...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Wilde. Nick Wilde.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: And you little guy, you want to be an elephant when you grow up... you be an elephant-- because this is Zootopia, anyone can be anything.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Ah, boy, I tell him that all the time. All right here ya go--  Two paws. Yeah. Oh, look at that smile, that's a happy birthday smile! All right, give her a little bye-bye toot toot.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Toot, toot!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Bye now!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Goodbye!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Oh! Hey, little toot toot--

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Pawpsicles! Get your pawpsicles!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Lumber delivery!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: The color? Uh... It's redwood.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: 39...40. There you go. Way to work that diaper, big guy. Hey, no kiss bye-bye for daddy?

Speaker: finnick
Dialogue: You kiss me tomorrow, I'll bite your face off. Ciao.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Well. I stood up for you, and you lied to me. You liar!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: It's called a hustle, sweetheart. And I'm not the liar, he is.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Really, for what?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Gee I don't know, how `bout selling food without a permit, transporting undeclared commerce across borough lines, false advertising...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Permit. Receipt of declared commerce. And I didn't falsely advertise anything. Take care.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: You told that mouse the popsicle sticks were redwood!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: That's right. "Red wood." With a space in the middle. Wood that is red.  You can't touch me, Carrots, I been doing this since I was born.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: You're gonna wanna refrain from calling me Carrots...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: My bad. I just naturally assumed you came from some little carrot- choked podunk, no?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Ah, no. Podunk is in Deerbrooke County, and I grew up in Bunnyburrow.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Okay. Tell me if this story sounds familiar:  Nave little hick with good grades and big ideas decides, "Hey lookit me, I'm gonna move to Zootopia-- where Predators and Prey live in harmony and sing Kumbaya!" Only to find-- whoopsie, we don't all get along. And that dream of becoming a big city cop? Double whoopsie! She's a meter maid. And whoopsie number threesie-- NO ONE cares about her or her dreams. And soon enough those dreams die and our bunny sinks into emotional and literal squalor living in a box under a bridge. Til finally she has no choice but to go back home with that cute, fuzzy wuzzy little tail between her legs to become-- you're from Bunnyburrow, is that what you said?-- so how `bout a carrot farmer... That sound about right?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Hey! Hey! No one tells me what I can or can't be! Especially not some jerk who never had the guts to try to be anything more than a popsicle hustler!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Alright look, everyone comes to Zootopia thinking they can be anything they want. Well you can't. You can only be what you are.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: I am NOT a dumb bunny.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Right. And that's not wet cement.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Oh hey, it's my parents!

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: Aw there she is! Hi sweetheart!

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Hey there, Jude the Dude! How was your first day on the force?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: It was real great.

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: Yeah? Everything you ever hoped?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Mmm. Absolutely. And more. Everyone's so nice. And I feel like I'm really making a difference--

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Hey, wait a second. Holy cripes, Bonnie! Look at that!

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: Oh my sweet heaven-- Judy, are you a meter maid?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Oh this? No! Oh, no no! This is just a temporary thing--

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: It's the safest job on the force!

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Ah, she's not a real cop! Our prayers have been answered!

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: Glorious day!

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Meter maid, meter maid!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Dad! Dad--

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Meter maid, meter maid!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: DAD! You know what-- it's been a really long day, I should really--

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: That's right. You get some rest!

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Those meters aren't gonna maid themselves.

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: Bye bye!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Buh-bye.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Tomorrow's another day...

Speaker: moose
Dialogue: I was 30 seconds over!

Speaker: hippo child
Dialogue: My mommy says she wishes you were dead.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: I am a real cop. I am a real cop. I am a real cop. I am a real cop...

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Sir, if you have a grievance, you may contest your citation in traffic court.

Speaker: frantic pig
Dialogue: What're you talking about? My shop! It was just robbed! Look, he's getting away! Well are you a cop or not?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Oh, yes! Yes! Don't worry, sir, I got this!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Stop! Stop in the name of the law!

Speaker: duke weaselton
Dialogue: Catch me if you can, Cottontail!

Speaker: mchorn
Dialogue: This is Officer McHorn, we got a 10-

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: I got dibs! Officer Hopps, I am in pursuit!

Speaker: mchorn
Dialogue: Hey! Metermaid! Wait for the real cops!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Stop!

Speaker: duke weaselton
Dialogue: Bon voyage, flat foot!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Hey! Stop right there!

Speaker: duke weaselton
Dialogue: Have a donut, coppah!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: I love your hair.

Speaker: duke weaselton
Dialogue: Come to papa...

Speaker: clawhauser
Dialogue: Okay, you're gonna have to be patient and wait in line just like everyone else, Mrs. Otterton, okay?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: I popped the weasel!

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: HOPPS!

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Abandoning your post, inciting a scurry, reckless endangerment of rodents... but to be fair, you did stop a master criminal from stealing two dozen... moldy onions.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Hate to disagree with you, sir, but those aren't onions. Those are a crocus varietal called Midnicampum Holicithias. They're a Class C Botanical, sir. I grew up in a family where plant husbandry was kind of a thing.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Shut your tiny mouth, now.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Sir, I got the bad guy. That's my job.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Your job is putting tickets on parked cars.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Not now.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Not now!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Sir, I don't want to be a meter maid... I wanna be a real cop.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Do you think the Mayor asked what I wanted when he assigned you to me?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: But sir, if you--

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Life isn't some cartoon musical where you sing a little song and your insipid dreams magically come true. So let it go!

Speaker: clawhauser
Dialogue: I'm sorry, sir, I tried to stop her, she is super slippery. I gotta go sit down.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Ma'am, as I've told you, we are doing everything we can...

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Yes, I know.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Ma'am, our detectives are very busy.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Mrs. Otterton--

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Mrs. Otterton? Please wait out here.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: One second.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: What? Why?!

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Insubordination. Now, I'm going to open this door and you're going to tell that otter you're a former meter maid with delusions of grandeur who will not be taking the case.

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: I just heard Officer Hopps is taking the case!

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Assistant Mayor Bellwether...

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: The Mammal Inclusion Initiative is really starting to pay off! Mayor Lionheart is just gonna be so jazzed!

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: No! No, let's not tell the mayor just yet--

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: And I sent it, and it is done, so I did do that. All right, well I'd say the case is in good hands! Us little guys really need to stick together! Right?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Like glue!

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: Good one! Just call me if you ever need anything, okay? You've always got a friend at City Hall, Judy. Alright, bye bye!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Thank you, ma'am.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: I will give you 48 hours.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: YES!

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: That's two days to find Emmitt Otterton.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: But, you strike out-- you resign.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Oh, uh... okay... deal.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Splendid. Clawhauser will give you the complete case file.

Speaker: clawhauser
Dialogue: Here ya go! One missing otter!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: That's it?!

Speaker: clawhauser
Dialogue: Yikes! That is the smallest case file I've ever seen! Leads: none, witnesses: none-- and you're not in the computer system yet, so resources: none.  I hope you didn't stake your career on cracking this one.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Okay.  "Last known sighting..."

Speaker: clawhauser
Dialogue: The murder weapon!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Get your pawpsicle...

Speaker: clawhauser
Dialogue: Yeah, `cause that... What does that mean?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: It means I... have a lead.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Hi! Hello? It's me again!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Hey, it's Officer Toot Toot.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Ha-ha-ho, no actually it's Officer Hopps, and I'm here to ask you some questions about a case.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: What happened, meter maid? Did someone steal a traffic cone? It wasn't me.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: This is important, sir. I think your ten dollars worth of popsicles can wait.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I make 200 bucks a day, fluff. 365 days a year, since I was 12, and time is money, hop along.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Please, just look at the picture.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I know everybody. And I also know that somewhere there's a toy store missing its stuffed animal, so why don't you get back to your box.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Fine. Then we'll have to do this the hard way.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Did you just boot my stroller?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Nicholas Wilde, you are under arrest.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: For what? Howting your feewings?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Felony tax evasion.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Well, it's my word against yours.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Actually, it's your word against yours. And if you want this pen, you're going to help me find this poor missing otter or the only place you'll be selling popsicles is the prison cafeteria.  It's called a hustle, sweetheart.

Speaker: finnick
Dialogue: She hustled you.  She hustled you good! You're a cop now Nick, you're gonna need one of these! Have fun working with the fuzz!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Start talking.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I don't know where he is. I only saw where he went.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Great, let's go.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: It's not exactly a place for a cute little bunny.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Don't call me cute.  Get in the car.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Okay. You're the boss.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Hi, hello.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Uh, no... I'm Officer Hopps, ZPD. I'm looking for a missing mammal, Emmitt Otterton. Right here--  --who may have frequented this establishment.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Oh, thank you so much, I'd appreciate that more than you can imagine. It would be such a big--  You are naked!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Yeah, in Zootopia anyone can be anything. These guys... they be naked.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Does this make you uncomfortable? Because, if so, there's no shame in calling it quits.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Yes there is.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Boy, that's the spirit.

Speaker: nangi
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: yax
Dialogue: Uh, Emmitt Otterton? Been coming to your yoga class for like 6 years?

Speaker: nangi
Dialogue: I have no memory of this beaver.

Speaker: judy
Dialogue: He's an otter actually.

Speaker: yax
Dialogue: He was here a couple Wednesdays ago. `Member?

Speaker: nangi
Dialogue: Nope.

Speaker: yax
Dialogue: Yeah, he was wearing a green cable- knit sweater vest, and new pair of corduroy slacks. Oh, and a paisley tie. Sweet Windsor knot. Real tight. Remember that Nangi?

Speaker: nangi
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: yax
Dialogue: Yeah, and we both walked him out and he got into this big ol' white car with a silver trim? Needed a tune up. The third cylinder wasn't firing. `Member that, Nangi?

Speaker: nangi
Dialogue: Nope.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: You didn't happen to catch the license plate number, did you?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: 0, 3... Wow, this is a lot of great info, thank you.

Speaker: yax
Dialogue: Told ya Nangi has a mind like a steel trap. I wish I had a memory like an elephant.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Well, I had a ball. You are welcome for the clue. And seeing as how any moron can run a plate, I will take that pen and bid you adieu.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: The plate... I can't run a plate...  I'm not in the system yet.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Give me the pen please.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: What was it you said? "Any moron can run a plate?" Gosh... if only there were a moron around who were up to the task...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Rabbit, I did what you asked, you can't keep me on the hook forever.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Not forever. Why, I only have 36 hours left to solve this case. So can you run the plate or not?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Actually, I just remembered I have a pal at the DMV...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Flash is the fastest guy in there, you need something done, he's on it.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: I hope so, we are really fighting the clock and every minute counts.  Wait. They're all sloths?!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: What? Are you saying that because he's a sloth, he can't be fast? I thought in Zootopia anyone could be anything.

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Nice to...  too.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Hey Flash, I'd love ya to meet my friend-- uh, darlin' I've forgotten your name.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: How are ya?

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: I am... doing... just...

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Fine?

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: ...as well... as... I can... be. What...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Hang in there.

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: ...can I... do...

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Well, I was hoping you could run a plate--

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: For you...

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Well, I was hoping you could--

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: ...today.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Well, I was hoping you could run a plate for us. We are in a really big hurry.

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Sure.    What's the... plate...

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: ...Number?

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: T.

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: H.

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: D.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Hey Flash, wanna hear a joke?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: What do you call a three humped camel?

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: I don't... know...  What... do... you call... a...

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Three humped camel.

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Three humped... camel?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Pregnant.

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Ha... ha... ha... ha...

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Ha, ha, yes very funny, very funny, can we please just focus on the task--

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Hey... Priscilla...

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Oh no!

Speaker: priscilla
Dialogue: Yes... Flash?

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: What... do...

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: You call... a...

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: A three humped camel? Pregnant! Okay, great, we got it, please just- -

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Three... humped...

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Aggggggghhhhhhh--

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Here...

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah, yeah... thank you!

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: You... go.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: 29THD03-- it's registered to... Tundratown Limo Service? A limo took Otterton, and the limo's in Tundratown-- it's in Tundratown!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Way to hustle, bud. I love ya. I owe ya.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Hurry, we gotta beat the rush hour and--

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: IT'S NIGHT?!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Closed. Great.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Mm. And I will betcha you don't have a warrant to get in. Hm? Darn it. It's a bummer.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: You wasted the day on purpose.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Madam, I have a fake badge. I would never impede your pretend investigation.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: It's not a pretend investigation! Look, see--  See him? This otter is missing.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Well then they should have gotten a real cop to find him.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: What is your problem? Does seeing me fail somehow make you feel better about your own sad, miserable life?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: It does. One hundred percent.  Now... since you're sans warrant, I guess we're done?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Fine. We are done. Here's your pen.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: The thing is, you don't need a warrant if you have probable cause, and I'm pretty sure I saw a shifty low-life climbing the fence, so you're helping plenty. Come on.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Polar bear fur.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: OH MY GOD!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: What? What?!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: The Velvety Pipes of Jerry Vole! But on CD? Who still uses CDs?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Those are... claw marks. You ever seen anything like this?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Oh, wait. Look.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Well, now wait a minute...  I know whose car this is. We gotta go!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Why? Whose car is it?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: The most feared crime boss in Tundratown. They call him Mr. Big and he does not like me, so we gotta go!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: I'm not leaving, this is a crime scene.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Well, it's gonna be an even bigger crime scene if Mr. Big finds me here, so we're leaving right now!  Nick ushers Hopps to the door, but opens it to find two big POLAR BEARS.  NICK  That's a no.  ...and yank them off screen.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: What did you do that made Mr. Big so mad at you?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I uh, I may have sold him a very expensive wool rug... that was made from the fur of a... skunk's butt.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Oh, sweet cheese and crackers.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Is that Mr. Big?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: What about him? Is that him?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: That's gotta be him.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Stop talking stop talking stop talking--

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Well actually we were brought here against our will, so...  Point is, I did not know it was your car, and I certainly did not know about your daughter's wedding.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Sir, I am a c--

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Mime! She is a mime. This mime, cannot speak. You can't speak if you're a mime.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: No. I am a cop. And I'm on the Emmitt Otterton case, and my evidence puts him in your car, so intimidate me all you want, I'm going to find out what you did to that otter if it's the last thing I do.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Whoa-- I didn't see nothing-- I'm not saying nothing--

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Please! No no no! If you're mad at me about the rug I've got more rugs!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Hi.  I love your dress.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Because he was attacked.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Otterton?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: He's a sweet little otter.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Mr. Manchas? Judy Hopps, ZPD. We just want to know what happened to Emmitt Otterton.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Whoa. A teensy otter... did that?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: What... happened?

Speaker: manchas
Dialogue: There was no warning, he just kept yelling about the "night howlers." Over and over, "the night howlers..."

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Oh. So you know about the night howlers too? Good, good, good. Because the night howlers are exactly what we are here to talk about.  Right?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Yep. So, uh, you just open the door and tell us what you know and we will tell you what we know. Okay?

Speaker: manchas
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Clever fox.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Buddy?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Are you... okay?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: What is wrong with him?!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: I don't know!!  Nick and Hopps run across the bridge. Manchas closes in.  HOPPS  Officer Hopps to dispatch!

Speaker: clawhauser
Dialogue: Are you familiar with Gazelle? Greatest singer of our lifetime-- angel with horns-- okay, hold on, keep watching. Who's that beside her? Who is it?

Speaker: clawhauser
Dialogue: Hold on a second--

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Clawhauser, listen to me! We have a 10-91! Jaguar gone savage! Vine and Tu-junja!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: It's Tujunga!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: There! Head to the skytrams!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Get in! Carrots? Carrots!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Go!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: No, no, no!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: I'm gonna let go!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: No, you what? No, I said-- listen-- noooo!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: One, two--

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Carrots. You saved my life.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Well. That's what we do at the ZP...  Deeeeeeeeeeeee.....

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Well, this should be good.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: I thought this was just a missing mammal case, but it's way bigger.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Savage? This isn't the Stone Age, Hopps. Animals don't go savage.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: I thought so too, `til I saw this:

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: The "savage" jaguar.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Sir, I know what I saw-- he almost killed us.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Or maybe any aggressive predator looks savage to you rabbits.  Let's go.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Wait-- Sir, I'm not the only one who saw him!  Nick!

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: You think I'm going to believe a fox?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Well he was a key witness and I enlisted--

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: But, Sir, we...

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Badge.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: What did you say, fox?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Sorry, what I said was, "no." She will not be giving you that badge. Look, you gave her a clown vest and a three-wheel joke-mobile and two days to solve a case you guys haven't cracked in two weeks? Yeah, no wonder she needed to get help from a fox, none of you guys were gonna help her, were you?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Never let `em see that they get to you.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: So, things do get to you...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: No... I mean, not anymore. But I was small and emotionally unbalanced like you once.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Har-har.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: No, it's true. I think was 8, or maybe 9, and all I wanted to do was join the Junior Ranger Scouts.

Speaker: young nick
Dialogue: Yeah! Pretty much born ready.

Speaker: young nick
Dialogue: I, Nicholas Wilde, promise to be brave, loyal, helpful, and trustworthy.

Speaker: young nick
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I learned two things that day. One, I was never gonna let anyone see that they got to me.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: ...And two?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: If the world's only gonna see a fox as shifty and untrustworthy, there's no point in trying to be anything else.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Nick, you are so much more than that...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Boy, look at that traffic down there.  How about we go out to Chuck in Traffic Central-- Chuck, how are things looking on the Jam Cams?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Nick, I'm glad you told me...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: The Jam Cams...!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Seriously, it's okay...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: No-n-shh-shush! There are traffic cameras everywhere. All over the canopy. Whatever happened to that jaguar--

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: The traffic cams would have caught it!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Bingo!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Pretty sneaky, Slick.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: However. If you didn't have access to the system before, I doubt Chief Buffalo Butt is gonna let you into it now.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: No... But I have a friend at City Hall who might.

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: Sir? If we could just review these very important--  Sir?

Speaker: lionheart
Dialogue: Okay. I heard you, Bellwether. Just take care of it!  Please. And clear my afternoon, I'm going out.

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: No, no! But, sir, you do have a meeting with Herds and Grazing... sir, if I could just--

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Assistant Mayor Bellwether? We need your help.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: We just need to get into the traffic cam database.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: So fluffy!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Sheep never let me this close.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: You can't just touch a sheep's wool...

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: Where to?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Rainforest District, Vine and Tujunga.

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: There! Traffic cams for the whole city. This is so exciting, actually. Well, you know, I never get to do anything this important.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: But you're the Assistant Mayor of Zootopia.

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: Oh, I'm more of a glorified secretary. I think Mayor Lionheart just wanted the sheep vote...  But he did give me that nice mug.

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: That's a fun little name he likes to use. I called him Lionfart once. He did not care for that, let me tell you. It was not a good day for me.  Yes, sir?

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: Oh, dear. I better go --  Let me know what you find. It was really nice for me to be--

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: You think when she goes to sleep she counts herself?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Shush. Okay, traffic cams...  Tujunga, Tujunga... we're in.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Timberwolves. Look at these dumdums.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Howlers! Night howlers! That's what Manchas was afraid of... wolves! The wolves are the night howlers. If they took Manchas...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: ...I bet they took Otterton too.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: All we gotta do is find out where they went.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: You know, if I wanted to avoid surveillance because I was doing something illegal-- which I never have-- I would use the maintenance tunnel 6B... which would put them out...

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Well, look at you, Junior Detective. You know, I think you'd actually make a pretty good cop.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: How dare you.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: They're heading out of town... Where does that road go?

Speaker: wolf guard
Dialogue: Gary, quit it, you're gonna start a howl.

Speaker: wolf guard
Dialogue: Oooooooooo!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Come on!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: You are a clever bunny.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: It looks like this was a hospital.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: You know, after you, you're the cop.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Okay. All clear.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: All this equipment is brand new...

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Claw marks...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Yeah. Huge, huge, claw marks. I mean, what kind of--

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Mr. Manchas.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Or not. Guess he's in no rush to get home to the Missus.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: ...11, 12, 13, 14. Not including Manchas it's 14...  Chief Bogo handed out 14 Missing Mammal files... They're all here. All the missing mammals are right here.

Speaker: badger doctor
Dialogue: Mayor Lionheart, please, we're doing everything we can.

Speaker: lionheart
Dialogue: Really? Cuz I got a dozen and a half animals here who've gone off the rails crazy-- and you can't tell me why. Now, I'd call that awfully far from doing everything.

Speaker: badger doctor
Dialogue: Sir, it may be time to consider their biology.

Speaker: lionheart
Dialogue: What? What do you mean biology?

Speaker: badger doctor
Dialogue: The only animals going savage are predators. We cannot keep it a secret. We need to come forward.

Speaker: lionheart
Dialogue: Hmm... Great idea. Tell the public. And how do you think they're gonna feel about their mayor, who is a lion?! I'll be ruined!

Speaker: badger doctor
Dialogue: Well, what does Chief Bogo say?

Speaker: lionheart
Dialogue: Chief Bogo doesn't know. And we are going to keep it that way.

Speaker: badger doctor
Dialogue: Sir, you need to go, now!  Security! Sweep the area!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Great! We're dead. We're dead. That's it. I'm dead. You're dead. Everybody's dead.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Can you swim?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: What? Can I swim? Yes, I can swim. Why?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: We gotta tell Bogo!

Speaker: clawhauser
Dialogue: Chief Bogo!

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Not now!

Speaker: clawhauser
Dialogue: Wait, is that Gazelle?

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: clawhauser
Dialogue: You have the app too?!  Oh, jeeeeez!

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Clawhauser, can't you see I'm working on the missing mammal cases?!

Speaker: clawhauser
Dialogue: Oh, yes of course! About that, sir... Officer Hopps just called... She found all of `em.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Mayor Lionheart, you have the right to remain silent. Anything--

Speaker: lionheart
Dialogue: You don't understand. I was trying to protect the city.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: You were just trying to protect your job.

Speaker: lionheart
Dialogue: No. Listen, we still don't know why this is happening. It could destroy Zootopia.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: You have the right to remain silent. Anything you say can and will be used against you in a court of law...

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Ladies and Gentlemammals... 14 mammals went missing and all 14 have been found by our newest recruit, who will speak to you in a moment. But first, let me remind you--

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Rrrgh. I am so nervous...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Okay, press conference 101: You wanna look smart?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: You should be there with me. We did this together.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Well, am I a cop? No. No, I am not.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Funny you should say that, because I've been thinking... it would be nice to have a partner.

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: Officer Hopps, it's time.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: So now, I'll turn things over to the officer who cracked the case. Officer Judy Hopps.

Speaker: press
Dialogue: Officer Hopps! / Over here! / Here!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: reporter
Dialogue: What can you tell us about the animals that went savage?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Well, the animals in question...  Are they all different species? Yes. Yes they are.

Speaker: reporter 2
Dialogue: Okay, so what is the connection?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Well, all we know is that they are all members of the predator family.

Speaker: another reporter
Dialogue: So, predators are the only ones going savage?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: That is accu-- Yes, that is accurate. Yes...

Speaker: reporter 3
Dialogue: Wow. Why is that happening?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: We still don't know--

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: A biological component. You know, something in their DNA...

Speaker: reporter 4
Dialogue: In their DNA? Can you elaborate on that, please?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Yes. What I mean is, thousands of years ago... um... predators survived through their aggressive hunting instincts. For whatever reason, they seem to be reverting back to their primitive, savage ways.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: It is possible. So we must be vigilant. And we at the ZPD are prepared and are here to protect you...

Speaker: press
Dialogue: Will more mammals go savage? / What is being done to protect us? / Have you considered a mandatory quarantine on predators?

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: Okay, thank you Officer Hopps, uh, that's all the time that we have. No more questions...

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Was I okay?

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: Oh, you did fine.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: That went so fast! I didn't get a chance to mention you or say anything about how we--

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Oh, I think you said plenty.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Clearly, there's a biological component? These predators may be reverting back to their primitive, savage ways. Are you serious?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: I just stated the facts of the case. I mean, it's not like a bunny could go savage...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Right. But a fox could? Huh?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Nick, stop it. You're not like them.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Oh, there's a them now?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: You know what I mean. You're not that kind of predator.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: The kind that needs to be muzzled? The kind that makes you think you need to carry around Fox Repellent?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: No. Nick. Nick!

Speaker: reporter 5
Dialogue: Officer Hopps! Were you just threatened by that predator?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: No. He's my friend.

Speaker: reporter 6
Dialogue: We can't even trust our own friends?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: That is not what I said! Please!

Speaker: reporters
Dialogue: Are we safe? / Have any other foxes gone savage?

Speaker: pig
Dialogue: Go back to the forest, predator!

Speaker: leopard
Dialogue: I'm from the savannah!

Speaker: gazelle
Dialogue: Zootopia is a unique place. It's a crazy, beautiful, diverse city where we celebrate our differences.  This is not the Zootopia I know.

Speaker: gazelle
Dialogue: We cannot let fear divide us. Please-- give me back the Zootopia I love...

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Come on Hopps. The new Mayor wants to see us.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: The Mayor? Why?

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: It would seem you've arrived.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Clawhauser? What're you doing?

Speaker: clawhauser
Dialogue: Um, they thought it would be better if a predator such as myself wasn't the first face you that you see when you walk into the ZPD.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: clawhauser
Dialogue: They're gonna move me to Records. It's downstairs. By the boiler.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Hopps!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Um... I don't understand.

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: Our city is 90% prey, Judy. And right now they're just really scared. You're a hero to them. They trust you. And so that's why Chief Bogo and I want you to be the public face of the ZPD.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: I'm not... I'm not a hero. I came here to make the world a better place, but I think I broke it.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Don't give yourself so much credit, Hopps. The world has always been broken. That's why we need good cops-- like you.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: With all due respect, sir, a good cop is supposed to serve and protect-- help the city. Not tear it apart.  I don't deserve this badge.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Hopps.

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: Judy, you've worked so hard to get here. It's what you've wanted since you were a kid. You can't quit...

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Thank you for the opportunity.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: A dozen carrots.

Speaker: rabbit mom
Dialogue: Thanks!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Have a nice day.

Speaker: rabbit mom
Dialogue: Come on.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Hey there, Jude-- Jude the dude, remember that one? How we doin?

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: You are not fine. Your ears are droopy.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Why did I think I could make a difference?

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Because you're a trier, that's why.

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: You've always been a trier.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Oh, I tried. And it made life so much worse for so many innocent predators.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Oh, not all of them, though. Speak of the devil. Right on time.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Is that... Gideon Grey?

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Yep. It sure is. We work with him now.

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: He's our partner. And we never would have considered it had you not opened our minds.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: That's right. I mean, Gid's turned into one of the top pastry chefs in the tri-burrows.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: That's really cool, you guys.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Well, I know a thing or two about being a jerk...

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Hey kids! Don't you run through that midnicampum holicithias!

Speaker: rabbit kid
Dialogue: Whoa, whoa, whoa!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: I'm sorry, what did you say?

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Oh, Gid's talking about those flowers, Judy. I use `em to keep bugs off the produce. But I don't like the little ones going near `em on account of what happened to your Uncle Terry.

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: Yeah, Terry ate one whole when we were kids and went completely nuts.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: He bit the dickens out of your mother.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: A bunny can go savage...

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: Savage? Well, that's a strong word. But it did hurt like the devil.

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: Well sure it did. There's a sizable divot in your arm. I'd call that savage.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Night howlers aren't wolves. They're flowers. The flowers are making the predators go savage. That's it! That's what I've been missing!

Speaker: stu hopps
Dialogue: You catch any of that, Bon?

Speaker: bonnie hopps
Dialogue: Not one bit.

Speaker: gideon grey
Dialogue: Well, that makes me feel a little better. I thought she was talking in tongues or something.

Speaker: finnick
Dialogue: Who is it?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: I need to find Nick. Please.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Nick? Nick!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Wow. Isn't that interesting.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Wait! Wait, please-- I know you'll never forgive me. And I don't blame you. I wouldn't forgive me either. I was ignorant and irresponsible and small-minded... But predators shouldn't suffer because of my mistakes. I have to fix this, but I can't do it without you.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Don't worry, Carrots, I'll let you erase it... in 48 hours.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I thought you guys only grew carrots.  What's the plan?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: We are gonna follow the night howlers.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Okay. How?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Know this guy?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Uh-huh. I told you, I know everybody.

Speaker: duke weaselton
Dialogue: Well, hello, step right up! Anything you need... I got it. All your favorite movies! I got movies that haven't even been released yet!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Well, well, look who it is. The duke of bootleg.

Speaker: duke weaselton
Dialogue: What's it to you, Wilde? Shouldn't you be melting down a popsicle or something?  Hey, if it isn't Flopsy the Copsy.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: We both know those weren't moldy onions I caught you stealing. What were you gonna do with those night howlers, Wessleton?

Speaker: duke weaselton
Dialogue: It's Weaselton. Duke Weaselton. And I ain't talking, rabbit. And ain't nothing you can do to make me.

Speaker: duke weaselton
Dialogue: Aaagh! Agh!  Ya dirty rat! Why ya helping her?! She's a cop!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Aw.

Speaker: duke weaselton
Dialogue: All right, all right, please! I'll talk! I'll talk. I stole them night howlers so I could sell `em. They offered me what I couldn't refuse... Money.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: And to whom did you sell them?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Come on!  As they sneak up to it... Hopps pulls open the window and looks inside the car. They both jump into...

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: The weasel wasn't lying.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Yeah, looks like old Doug's cornered the market on night howlers...

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: You got Doug here. What's the mark? Cheetah in Sahara Square. Got it.

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: Out.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Hey. Hey! Where are you going? Get back here! What are you doing?! He's gonna see you! What are you looking at? Hey! Whatever you're thinking, stop thinking it. Carrots! Carrots!

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: It better have the extra foam this time--

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: What are you doing?! You just trapped us in here!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: We need to get this evidence to the ZPD.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Okay. Great. Here it is. Got it.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: No. All of it!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Wait, what?

Speaker: doug
Dialogue: Oh! It just got worse!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Mission accomplished. Would it be premature for me to do a little victory toot-toot?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: All right. One toot-toot.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Well, I can cross that off the bucket list.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Don't stop! Keep going!

Speaker: jesse
Dialogue: No! No! Please stop!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Do not stop this car!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: There's another train coming!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Trust me! SPEED! UP!

Speaker: woolter
Dialogue: Stop the train! Hey!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Hey. Need some help?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Oh no! Oh no, no, no! Too fast! Hold on!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Okay... Maybe some of the evidence survived.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Yeah. Oh, except for this.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Oh, Nick! Yes!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Ow.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Come on! We gotta get to the ZPD. Cut through the Natural History Museum!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Oh! There it is!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Mayor Bellwether!  We found out what's happening. Someone's darting predators with a serum-- that's what's making them go savage.

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: I am so proud of you, Judy. You did just a super job.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Thank you, ma'am.  How did you know where to find us?

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: I'll go ahead and I'll take that case now.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: You know what... I think Nick and I will just take this to the ZPD...

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: Get them!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Ach!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Ah Carrots!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Pass.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Take the case. Get it to Bogo.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I'm not gonna leave you behind. That's not happening.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: I can't walk.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Just, we'll think of something.

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: We're on the same team, Judy!

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: Underestimated. Under-appreciated. Aren't you sick of it? Predators. They may be strong and loud, but prey out-number predators 10 to one.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: What are you going to do? Kill me?

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: No! Of course not... he is.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: No! Nick?!

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: Yes, police! There's a savage fox in the natural history museum. Officer Hopps is down! Please hurry!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: No. Nick, don't do this. Fight it.

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: Oh, but he can't help it, can he? Since preds are just biologically predisposed to be savages.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: So that's it, prey fears predator, and you stay in power?

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: Yeah, pretty much.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: It won't work.

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: Fear always works. And I'll dart every predator in Zootopia to keep it that way.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Oh, Nick! No!

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: Bye-Bye, Bunny.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Blood, blood, blood! And death.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: All right, you're milking it. Besides, I think we got it, I think we got it. We got it up there, thank you yakkety-yak-- you laid it all out beautifully.

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Yea, oh, are you looking for the serum?  Well, it's right here.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: What you've got in the weapon there- - those are blueberries. From my family's farm.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: They are delicious.  You should try some.

Speaker: bellwether
Dialogue: I framed Lionheart, I can frame you too! It's my word against yours!

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Oooo, actually--

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: --It's your word against yours. It's called a hustle, sweetheart. Boom.

Speaker: prey anchor
Dialogue: Her predecessor, Leodore Lionheart, denies any knowledge of her plot, claiming he was just trying to protect the city.

Speaker: lionheart
Dialogue: Did I falsely imprison those animals? Well, yes. Yes I did. It was a classic "doing the wrong thing for the right reason" kind of a deal.

Speaker: pred anchor
Dialogue: In related news, doctors say the night howler antidote is proving effective in rehabilitating the afflicted predators...

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: So, no matter what type of animal you are, from the biggest elephant to our first fox...

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: ...Enough! Shut it! We have some new recruits with us this morning, including our first fox. Who cares.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Ha! You should have your own line of inspirational greeting cards, sir.

Speaker: bogo
Dialogue: Shut your mouth, Wilde. Assignments! Officers Grizzoli, Fangmeyer, Delgato: Tundratown Swat. Snarlov, Higgins, Wolfard: Undercover. Hopps, Wilde...  Just kidding! We have reports of a street racer tearing up Savannah Central. Find him, shut him down.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: So are all rabbits bad drivers or is it just you?

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Oops. Sorry.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Sly bunny.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Dumb fox.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: You know you love me.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Do I know that? Yes. Yes, I do.

Speaker: hopps
Dialogue: Sir, you were going 115 miles per hour. I hope you have a good explanation.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Flash? Flash? Hundred yard dash?!

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Nick.
